intro: Lemboglossum cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf lemboglossum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the wetlands and marshes of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Due to its ecological importance and aesthetic appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
